page.title: 01Melling and Arkholme R.Lune.
page.content: Melling and Arkholme are villages on opposite sides of the R.Lune which flows through a beautiful valley with farms where cows and sheep graze. The river meanders, causing large shingle banks. Hills rise on each side and Ingleborough Hill can be seen. A road follows the river on each side through the villages that have a blend of very old and modern houses. Both villages are accessible from the M6 motorway. In Melling visitors are welcome at the residential Melling Hall Hotel that is close to the old church with its peal of bells. A motte lies behind the church. Arkholme also has a motte, like an upside down basin, dominating the church. The Brown Cow is the Arkholme local. Both villages have an Institute hall where various activities take place. <Continued........
